intro: Heliosperma macranthum, commonly known as the giant marsh orchid, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in dense inflorescences. Heliosperma macranthum plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystems, providing nectar for various pollinators.
